Text: DAY AHEAD CUTSnsf Good morningEve We had a few cuts with SC to SC trades for A new Hourahead template has been sent Idaho at SP NP We spoke to Kathy at Idaho and have bought the power back from Idaho at Expost the hourahead schedule that was cut sticks Avista ael SP This schedule was resubmitted as a whole schedule and our load has been decd Hours mw Thank you

FW Hanson and Pilot AnnuitiesPST Original Message From Cocke Jr Stanley Sent Saturday November AM To Mallory Chris Richter Jeff Foster Chris H Cc Platter Phillip Gang Lisa Bishop Serena Subject Hanson and Pilot Annuities All Ive entered an annuity for October and November Pilot Power scheduling fee for the November Hanson Cement scheduling fee and the booktobook transfer between West Services and Short Term California to split the scheduling fee Currently the fee for Pilot Power is per month per load zone scheduled SCE SDG and PGE and the scheduling fee for Hanson is The Enpower deal s are and Please take a few moments to review these annuities Going forward West Services will enter these annuities at the first of every month for the month ahead Thanks Stan Cocke Enron North America SW Salmon Portland OR o c

FW California schedulingPST Original Message From Bishop Serena Sent Thursday January AM To Richter Jeff Mallory Chris Platter Phillip ONeil Murray P Subject California scheduling Due to the tentative completion date of the UBS deal I think it would be wise for me to resume the duties of scheduling the California book as of Monday February After meeting with Murray I am under the impression that as of Wednesday you will be on UBS time and will not be doing the scheduling for the estate Let me know if you see a flaw in this plan thanks Serena Bishop

FW CAISO Notice Correction of FERC June Order Market NoticeFrom Happ Susan ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESHappCSusanCSHappcaisoEcomE NRONcom On Behalf Of Fuller Don Sent Wednesday June PM To ISO Market Participants Subject CAISO Notice Correction of FERC June Order Market Notice Importance High Resending due to the addition of footnotes This is a corrected version MARKET NOTICE For hour ending on June the California ISO will implement the following terms and provisions pursuant to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission FERC June Order concerning market mitigation measures for California and the Western System Coordinating Council FOR HOURS IN WHICH ISO DECLARES A SYSTEM EMERGENCY The ISO Realtime Imbalance Energy minute and Hourly Ex Post prices shall be set in accordance with FERCs April Order as clarified by FERCs June Order The Market Clearing Price MCP for Ancillary Services shall not exceed the Hourly Ex Post Price for the same hour in accordance with FERCs May Order as described in the CAISO Emergency NoticeMay FERC Order On Implementation of the Price Mitigation Plan in April Order FOR HOURS IN WHICH ISO DOES NOT DECLARE A SYSTEM EMERGENCY The ISO Realtime Imbalance Energy MCP shall be no greater than percent of the highest Hourly market clearing price established when the last Stage emergency was in effect The ISO Ancillary Services MCP shall be no greater than percent of the maximum Hourly market clearing price established when the last Stage emergency was in effect APPLICABLE TO ALL HOURS The systemwide gas price utilized to calculate the Proxy Price mandated by the April Order as clarified by the June Order shall be based on the simple average of the Gas Daily midpoint monthly bidweek SoCalGas large package Malin and PGE Citygate prices For June this average is mmBtu The ISO is required to add percent to the MCP paid to generators for all prospective sales in its markets to reflect credit uncertainty The prices posted on the ISO Web Site do not reflect the percent markup Footnotes Capitalized terms not otherwise defined herein are used in the meaning set forth in the Master Definitions Supplement Appendix A to the ISO Tariff The ISO is implementing those provisions for which it can make the requisite system changes immediately and will implement the remaining provisions as soon as possible The maximum MCP for nonemergency hours selling into CAISO markets effective June and until after the next Stage emergency shall be based on the highest hourly MCP during the most recent Stage emergency of MWh The ISO continues to assess the June Order and the steps necessary to implement the Order We will be issuing subsequent Market Notices as may be appropriate with respect to implementation of the June Order CAISO Market Operations
